answers.answer: Kara,Judging from your msg, I interpret that you are under 18 and for legal reasons we cannot answer your question here.You can, however, get online help from our "sister site" also run by Juvenile Diabetes Research Foundation (JDRF) volunteers.  It's called JDRF Online Diabetes Support Team and ask your Question there.Visit http://www.jdrf.org and look in the Center column near the Bottom.  Click on the link labeled

question: Hi, I am worried that I may be developing signs of type 1 diabetes.Just yesterday and today I have been drinking way more water than I usually need to drink (usually after I have something to eat I get like a constant thirst), last night I woke up with pains in my stomach and was very thirsty, today at times i notice that I am breathing heavier, I go through stages of extreme fatigue and I have noticed that I have lost a bit of weight.Over the past month or so I have felt as if I am constantly hungry and are forever snacking on food, but today I haven't felt that hungry at all.Also diabetes runs in my family.But the thing I am most worried about is that my final exams for my last year of high school start in just a week and I am worried that if I go and see a doctor and get diagnosed with diabetes I might need to go to hospitaland therefore won't have time to study!If i do have diabetes, how quickly will it be before the symptoms get worse, and what will be likely to happen if i hold off seeing  a doctor for a few weeks??
title: symptoms of diabetes?
